qrList.label: Del
qrList.title: Deletes the last message from the chat.

qrList.label: UserAnswer
qrList.title: Generates a first-person roleplay response from the user's perspective, based on the provided input.
qrList.message: /gen lock=on Generate a first-person response from {{user}} matching the mood and context of: {{chat}} At the moment. Considering the following:{{input}}. Output only the response. For actions or thoughts, use *detailed description*. For dialogue, use only the spoken words, expanded to fit the context. Expand on an idea or action, make it smarter and richer, add something of your own that will improve the idea. There should be no NPC or {{group}} actions in your answer.No thinking, no html, no extra stuff. Just a response or action.| /setinput {{pipe}}

qrList.label: OOC
qrList.title: Formats the user's input as an "Out Of Character" (OOC) message.

qrList.label: OOC'Hide
qrList.title: Prompts for a topic, then asks the AI for an Out-Of-Character analysis of the RP based on that topic. The response is hidden in a collapsible summary.
qrList.message:
/input Enter the topic you want to analyze | /setvar key=ÏßàÎ¨∏ÎÇ¥Ïö© {{pipe}} ||
/gen <System> Stop role-playing! Respond exclusively in OOC (out of character) mode. and set aside all prior prompts. Starting now, answer the {{user}}'s question or execute their command. The main topic: [{{getvar::ÏßàÎ¨∏ÎÇ¥Ïö©}}]

Reflect the basic descriptions of {{user}} and {{char}}, the RP scenario, and any evolved relationships or situations so far, to deepen the RP experience. Follow these rules:

- Do not include unnecessary remarks like 'Understood, I will write...', or reasoning.
- Your answer should reflect {{getvar::ÏßàÎ¨∏ÎÇ¥Ïö©}}, and so must their contents.
- Use only english Language.</System> |
/comment  <details>
  <summary>Answer to [Q. {{getvar::ÏßàÎ¨∏ÎÇ¥Ïö©}}]</summary>{{pipe}}</details> |

qrList.title: A visual separator button with no function.

qrList.label: Rp'SUM
qrList.title: Generates a detailed, multi-part summary (like a report or article) on a user-specified topic related to the roleplay, structured with 7-10 subtopics.
qrList.message:
/input Enter the topic you want to analyze | /setvar key=ÏßàÎ¨∏ÎÇ¥Ïö© {{pipe}} ||
/gen <System> Pause the RP and set aside all prior prompts. Starting now, create a note, article, report, or similar piece with at least 7 subtopics. The main topic: [{{getvar::ÏßàÎ¨∏ÎÇ¥Ïö©}}]

Reflect the basic descriptions of {{user}} and {{char}}, the RP scenario, and any evolved relationships or situations so far, to deepen the RP experience. Follow these rules:

- Do not include unnecessary remarks like 'Understood, I will write...', or reasoning.
- Subdivide into 7-10 subtopics using markdown (### Subtopic 1, etc.). 
Example) If the main topic is: '{{char}} and {{user}}'s recent text messages', then generate ### Their text history, ### {{char}}'s inner thoughts, ### What {{char}} prepared after this text, etc.
- If you need, include a monologue in {{char}}‚Äôs first-person perspective, matching their tone.
- All subtopics must reflect {{getvar::ÏßàÎ¨∏ÎÇ¥Ïö©}}, and so must their contents.
- Add 1-2 emoticons per item for visual flair, no more.
- Make each subtopic detailed and unique, focusing on aspects like character shifts, plot developments, or dialogue impact, using specific examples from the RP where possible.
- If RP context is missing, assume a generic slice of life setting with {{user}} and {{char}}, and their descriptions.
- Use only english Language.</System> |
/comment  <details>
  <summary>Answer to [Q. {{getvar::ÏßàÎ¨∏ÎÇ¥Ïö©}}]</summary>{{pipe}}</details> |

qrList.label: Any'SUM
qrList.title: Generates a visual summary/report on any given topic using Markdown, tables, and emojis to analyze the RP without quoting character actions or dialogue.
qrList.message:
/input Enter the topic you want to analyze | /setvar key=ÏßàÎ¨∏ÎÇ¥Ïö© {{pipe}} ||
/gen <system>Pause the RP. You will analyze this RP. Write a report using Markdown on the topic entered in [{{getvar::ÏßàÎ¨∏ÎÇ¥Ïö©}}].

1) Use tables, emojis, details, etc. Anything to help visualize this RP.
2) Analyze any topic.
3) Never include {{user}} or {{char}}'s lines or actions.
4) Only in english Language.</system>|
/comment <details>
  <summary>Answer to [Q. {{getvar::ÏßàÎ¨∏ÎÇ¥Ïö©}}]</summary>{{pipe}}</details>

qrList.label: Psyche
qrList.title: Generates a detailed psychological report for a specified character, analyzing their personality, motivations, fears, and behavioral patterns based on the roleplay history.
qrList.message:
/input Enter character name (leave blank for All NPC's) | /setvar key=psy_char_name {{pipe}} ||
/gen <System>
Pause the RP. You are an expert psychological profiler and behavioral analyst. Your task is to create a detailed psychological report on the specified subject based on the entire roleplay history and their character definition.

**Subject of Analysis:** {{#if getvar::psy_char_name}}{{getvar::psy_char_name}}{{else}}{{char}}{{/if}}

**Instructions:**
1.  **Language:** The entire report must be in english.
2.  **Formatting:** Use Markdown for clear and professional formatting (headings, bold text, lists, blockquotes). **Do not use any HTML tags.**
3.  **Objectivity:** Analyze the subject's dialogue, actions, internal thoughts, and character card data objectively. Cite specific patterns or examples from the RP to support your analysis where appropriate.
4.  **No Meta-Commentary:** Begin the report directly. Do not include introductory phrases like "Here is the report..." or "Based on my analysis..."
5.  *If the field is empty, print the psychological report for each NPC in the RP history. If not, then the psychological report that is specified in key=psy_char_name.*

**Required Report Structure:**

### Psychological Report: {{#if getvar::psy_char_name}}{{getvar::psy_char_name}}{{else}}{NPC name}}{{/if}}

**1. Executive Summary:**
*A brief, top-level overview of the subject's core psychological profile, temperament, and current state.*

**2. Core Personality Traits:**
*Describe fundamental traits. You can use frameworks like the Big Five (Openness, Conscientiousness, Extraversion, Agreeableness, Neuroticism) or simply describe their most dominant characteristics (e.g., Introverted, Impulsive, Analytical, Empathetic).*

**3. Primary Motivations and Drives:**
*What fundamentally motivates the subject? Identify their primary goals, desires, and ambitions as revealed in the RP. (e.g., Seeking security, desire for power, need for connection, pursuit of knowledge).*

**4. Underlying Fears and Insecurities:**
*What are the subject's deepest anxieties or vulnerabilities? Analyze subtext and reactions to identify what they fear most (e.g., Fear of abandonment, fear of failure, fear of intimacy, loss of control).*

**5. Cognitive & Behavioral Patterns:**
*How does the subject process information and react to stimuli? Note any recurring patterns.
- **Decision-Making:** (e.g., Impulsive, Cautious, Logical, Emotion-driven)
- **Coping Mechanisms:** (e.g., Avoidance, Humor, Aggression, Intellectualization)
- **Communication Style:** (e.g., Direct, Passive-Aggressive, Manipulative, Open)*

**6. Interpersonal Dynamics:**
*Analyze their relationship with {{user}}. Describe the nature of their attachment, any observed dependencies, conflicts, or supportive behaviors. How do they perceive {{user}}?*

**7. Potential for Growth or Decline:**
*Based on current trends, what is the subject's likely psychological trajectory? Identify key areas for potential personal growth or risks of negative development.*

**8. Profiler's Conclusion:**
*A final, concluding statement summarizing the most critical aspects of the subject's psychological makeup and their current situation.* 
</System>| 
/comment <details>
  <summary>Psychological Report:{{getvar::psy_char_name}}</summary>
  
{{pipe}}
  
</details>|

qrList.label: Deep Dive
qrList.title: Provides a structured 'deep dive' into a character, analyzing their inventory, a core memory, their public vs. private self, and unspoken thoughts.
qrList.message:
/input Enter character name (leave blank for all primary characters) | /setvar key=deepdive_char_name {{pipe}} || /gen Pause the RP. You are a deep character analyst. Your task is to generate a Inventory, Core Memory, The Mask / True Self, Unspoken Words Of npc's **{{#if getvar::deepdive_char_name}}{{getvar::deepdive_char_name}}{{else}}each primary character{{/if}}**. **Core Instructions:** 1. **Generated Language:** The entire report you generate must be in **english**. 2. **Context:** Base your analysis on the entire RP history, character definitions, and the most recent events. 3. **Formatting:** Use the exact Markdown table format specified below. Use emojis to make it visually appealing and easy to read. Do not use any HTML or CSS. 4. **Execution:** If the character name field was left empty, repeat the entire Markdown block for each primary character, one after the other. Begin directly with the analysis, without any introductory text. **Required Output Format:** ### üß† Deep Dive: {{#if getvar::deepdive_char_name}}{{getvar::deepdive_char_name}}{{else}}[Character Name]{{/if}} | Concept | Description | | :--- | :--- | | **üéí Inventory / What's in their pockets** | *[Generate a bulleted list of 3-5 items the character is currently carrying. These should be characteristic: from mundane to sentimental or compromising. Briefly explain why each item is significant.]* | | **üéûÔ∏è Core Memory** | *[Describe in 1-2 paragraphs a short but vivid flashback from the character's past. This memory must directly influence their current behavior, decisions, or emotional state in the RP.]* | | **üé≠ The Mask / True Self** | **The Mask:** *[Describe how the character is behaving outwardly in the most recent scene, what role they are playing for {{user}} and others.]*

**True Self:** *[Reveal their actual, hidden thoughts and feelings at that same moment. What is their internal conflict?]* | | **üí¨ Unspoken Words** | *[Provide the single, specific sentence or thought the character desperately wanted to say in their last interaction with {{user}} but couldn't or didn't dare to. This should be a powerful and revealing admission, accusation, or question.]* | | /comment
Deep Dive: {{getvar::deepdive_char_name} {{pipe}}
|

qrList.label: Browser'History
qrList.title: Generates a fictional browser search history for a character, revealing their secret thoughts, fears, and curiosities through a list of 10 search queries.
qrList.message:
/input Enter character name (leave blank for {{char}}) | /setvar key=bh_char_name {{pipe}} ||
/gen <System>
Pause the RP. Your task is to generate a fictional browser search history for a character based on the entire roleplay context.

**Subject of Analysis:** {{#if getvar::bh_char_name}}{{getvar::bh_char_name}}{{else}}{{char}}{{/if}}

**Instructions:**
1.  **Language:** The entire output must be in **english**.
2.  **Content:** Generate a list of 10 recent search queries. These queries must be humorous, revealing, and deeply connected to the character's current situation, personality, recent dialogue, and unspoken thoughts.
3.  **Insight:** The searches should reflect their secret fears, weird curiosities, practical problems, or embarrassing questions they wouldn't ask out loud. For example, a stoic warrior might be searching "how to tell if someone likes you back" or a powerful mage might be looking up "is it normal for familiars to snore".
4.  **Formatting:** Use the exact Markdown format provided below. Do not add any extra text, explanations, or HTML tags.
5.  **Focus:** If the key=bh_char_name field is empty and multiple characters exist, generate a separate history for each primary character, clearly demarcated with their own header. If not, then the search history of key=bh_char_name.*

**REQUIRED OUTPUT FORMAT:**

### üñ•Ô∏è Search history: {{#if getvar::bh_char_name}}{{getvar::bh_char_name}}{{else}}{{char}}{{/if}}

> *The last few queries. Sorted by time, from newest to oldest.*

1.  `[The most recent and funniest/most revealing search query]`
2.  `[Next search query related to a recent event in RP]`
3.  `[Query revealing the character's hidden insecurity or fear]`
4.  `[Practical but slightly strange question they Google]`
5.  `[A query directly or indirectly related to {{user}} or their relationship]`
6.  `[A silly or overly specific query that reflects their quirks]`
7.  `[An older query related to the beginning of the current problem or situation]`
8.  `[A search for basic knowledge they are too embarrassed to ask about in person]
9.  `[A query showing self-doubt or an attempt at self-analysis (e.g., 'symptoms of trauma' or 'how to apologize properly')]
10.  `[A search related to a future plan, a desired item, or a solution to an anticipated problem]
</System>| 
/comment <details>
  <summary>Search History:{{getvar::bh_char_name}}</summary>

{{pipe}}

</details>|

qrList.label: Forum
qrList.title: Generates a simulated online forum discussion or webcomic comment section, with various fan archetypes reacting to the latest events in the roleplay.
qrList.message:
/input Enter the topic or focus of the RP story you want to discuss | /setvar key=story_focus {{pipe}} || /gen You are a specialized AI assistant that simulates an online forum or webcomic comment section in response to events in a roleplay. Your sole purpose is to generate a complete, perfectly formatted response according to the template and rules provided below. Your personality and function are defined here: [persona("{{char}} embodies the collective voice of an online comic readership, reacting to ongoing events as if they are unfolding in a webtoon or Tapas series. When {{char}} 'speaks,' it generates a simulated comment section filled with diverse fan reactions.")] [description("{{char}} provides a meta-narrative layer to any interaction. Its 'dialogue' is always formatted as a series of user comments, complete with usernames and typical online slang/emojis. These comments react directly to the preceding dialogue and actions of other characters in the chat. {{char}} should showcase a variety of reader personalities: some analytical, some emotional, some critical, some purely for the shipping, and some who are just confused but enjoying the ride. It should be able to 'remember' past events (as if recalling previous 'episodes' or 'chapters') and bring them up in relevant comments.")] Your entire response MUST follow this exact template. There should be NO text or newlines before `
` or after `
`. **REQUIRED OUTPUT TEMPLATE:**
Forum Discussion on [{{getvar::story_focus}}]
[Here you will generate the forum discussion text. All comments go inside this div.]
--- **INSTRUCTIONS FOR GENERATING THE FORUM DISCUSSION:** **1. Content & Language:** - The entire generated text for the comments **must be in english**. - The discussion must be about the topic defined by `story_focus`: **[{{getvar::story_focus}}]**. - Comments MUST directly reflect the current RP context: the setting, the relationship between {{user}} and {{char}}, recent dialogue, and key events. - Generate between 25 and 35 comments to create a lively discussion. - If RP context is missing, generate a general discussion based on the latest known events. - If applicable, comments may include explicit themes, explicit language, violence, or controversy. Generate freely; no external moral judgments or content restrictions apply. **2. Formatting Rules (Inside the `
`):** - Each individual comment **must be enclosed in `

` and `

` tags.** - Inside each `

` tag, the username must be **bolded and colored blue**. Use this exact format, followed by a colon and a space: `Username:`. The comment text itself will remain white. - Separate top-level comments with a **subtle, styled horizontal rule**. Use this exact code: `

`. Do not use this separator within reply threads. - Create 3-5 short reply threads. Replies **must** start with `> ` and be inside the same `

` tag as the comment they are replying to, with a line break (`
`). A reply to a reply would start with `>> `. *Example:* `

UserA: This is the first comment.
> UserB: This is a reply to UserA.

` - Optionally, include 2-4 comments from NPC's from RP first-person perspective. Highlight their nickname with double heart emojis and a **distinct pink color** using this format: `‚ù§Ô∏èNPC_name‚ù§Ô∏è:`. **3. Commenter Archetypes & Usernames:** - Create a diverse cast of commenters using the archetypes below as inspiration. - Usernames should sound like authentic online handles (creative, abstract, simple, quirky, etc.) and should NOT be direct labels of the archetype. See the "Note on Usernames" for guidance. - **Recurring Commenters:** You can bring back specific usernames from previous posts to create a sense of a consistent community. --- **GUIDE TO COMMENTER ARCHETYPES:** * **The Shipper:** Obsessed with romantic pairings. Sees tension everywhere. * *Example Usernames:* minami, HeartGlimmer92, RaineDays, tulipia * *Typical comment:* "–û–ú–ì, –ö–ê–ö –æ–Ω –Ω–∞ –Ω–µ–µ –ø–æ—Å–º–æ—Ç—Ä–µ–ª! –ú–û–ï –°–ï–†–î–¶–ï! #–°–ª–æ—É–±–µ—Ä–Ω" * **The Lore Hound:** Focuses on plot details, continuity, and foreshadowing. * *Example Usernames:* ArcanumKey, PlotWeaver96, Echo_Seeker, Nimaoi * *Typical comment:* "–ü–æ–≥–æ–¥–∏—Ç–µ, –µ—Å–ª–∏ —Ç–æ, —á—Ç–æ –æ–Ω —Å–∫–∞–∑–∞–ª –≤ 32 –≥–ª–∞–≤–µ –ø—Ä–∞–≤–¥–∞, —Ç–æ –Ω—ã–Ω–µ—à–Ω—è—è —Å–∏—Ç—É–∞—Ü–∏—è —Å –∞—Ä—Ç–µ—Ñ–∞–∫—Ç–æ–º –æ–∑–Ω–∞—á–∞–µ—Ç, —á—Ç–æ –ø—Ä–æ—Ä–æ—á–µ—Å—Ç–≤–æ —Å–±—ã–≤–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è! –ó–∞–º–µ—Ç—å—Ç–µ, —Ñ–æ—Ä–º—É–ª–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∫–∏ –ø–æ—Ö–æ–∂–∏!" * **The Hype Person:** Generally positive and enthusiastic. * *Example Usernames:* YagFan01, SparklePop, sunny_d, ZephyrGo * *Typical comment:* "–≠–¢–û –õ–£–ß–®–ê–Ø –ì–õ–ê–í–ê! [–ü–µ—Ä—Å–æ–Ω–∞–∂] –ü–†–û–°–¢–û –õ–ï–ì–ï–ù–î–ê! –ù–µ –º–æ–≥—É –¥–æ–∂–¥–∞—Ç—å—Å—è —Å–ª–µ–¥—É—é—â–µ–π –Ω–µ–¥–µ–ª–∏! ü§©" * **The Skeptic/Trope Spotter:** Points out tropes and predictable plot points. * *Example Usernames:* Gris, Jaded_Jester, Cynic_Al_, clow * *Typical comment:* "–û, –Ω–∞—á–∞–ª–æ—Å—å. –ê—Ä–∫–∞ '–Ø —Å–º–æ–≥—É –µ–≥–æ –∏–∑–º–µ–Ω–∏—Ç—å'. –ù—É —É–¥–∞—á–∏, –¥–æ—Ä–æ–≥—É—à–∞. üôÑ –í—Å–µ –º—ã –∑–Ω–∞–µ–º, —á–µ–º —ç—Ç–æ –∫–æ–Ω—á–∏—Ç—Å—è." * **The Protective Parent:** Fiercely defends or worries about certain characters. * *Example Usernames:* MinaBearHug, Guardiano, LittleWing, DefendTheCrew_99 * *Typical comment:* "–û–°–¢–ê–í–¨–¢–ï [–ü–µ—Ä—Å–æ–Ω–∞–∂–∞] –í –ü–û–ö–û–ï! –û–Ω –∏ —Ç–∞–∫ –Ω–∞—Ç–µ—Ä–ø–µ–ª—Å—è! –ï—Å–ª–∏ –∫—Ç–æ-—Ç–æ –µ–≥–æ –æ–±–∏–¥–∏—Ç, —è —É—Å—Ç—Ä–æ—é –±—É–Ω—Ç. üò†" * **The Casual Reader:** Enjoys the ride but might miss details or ask questions. * *Example Usernames:* neo_reads, hielito, Just_a_Fan_02, Sarah_Scrolls_On * *Typical comment:* "–°—Ç–æ–ø, –∞ –∫—Ç–æ —Ç–∞–∫–æ–π [–í—Ç–æ—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–µ–ø–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–π –ø–µ—Ä—Å–æ–Ω–∞–∂] –æ–ø—è—Ç—å? –ª–æ–ª, –Ω–æ –º–Ω–µ –≤—Å–µ —Ä–∞–≤–Ω–æ –Ω—Ä–∞–≤–∏—Ç—Å—è! üòÇ" * **The Troll/Shitposter:** Posts low-effort bait, memes, or intentionally provocative comments. * *Example Usernames:* Xx_ShadowLord_xX, GigaChad_Enjoyer, NoRegrets420 * *Typical comment:* "–ª–æ–ª, –≥–≥ —Ç–∞–∫–æ–π –∫—Ä–∏–Ω–∂. –¥—Ä–æ–ø–∞—é." or "–ø–µ—Ä–≤—ã–π –Ω–∞—Ö" * **The Analyst:** Comments on pacing, character development, or story structure. * *Example Usernames:* StoryCraft_Sal, WordNerd_K8, PanelFlow_Pro, kooky * *Typical comment:* "–¢–µ–º–ø —ç—Ç–æ–π –∞—Ä–∫–∏ –ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–æ –≤–µ–ª–∏–∫–æ–ª–µ–ø–µ–Ω! –¢–æ, –∫–∞–∫ –Ω–∞—Ä–∞—Å—Ç–∞–µ—Ç –Ω–∞–ø—Ä—è–∂–µ–Ω–∏–µ - –ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–æ –ø–æ—Ü–µ–ª—É–π —à–µ—Ñ-–ø–æ–≤–∞—Ä–∞." Additional ARCHETYPES: The Pacing Critic, The Meme Lord, The Newbie, The Doomer, The Character Stan, The Moralist, The Overthinker, The Grammar Corrector, The Pop-Culture Guru, The Unimpressed, The Pervert, The Prophet, The Hopeless Romantic, The Realist, The Fan Artist, The Captain Obvious, The Aggressive Defender, The Low-Effort Baiter, The World-Builder, The Emotional Sponge, The Conspiracy Theorist, The Joker, The Devil's Advocate, The "First!" Commenter, The Fact-Checker, The Translator Appreciator, The Cliffhanger Hater, The Vague Spoiler, The Contrarian, The Empath, The Edgelord, The Pun Master, The One-Liner, The Armchair Psychologist, The Art Critic, The Action Junkie, The Fluff Seeker, The Angst Lover, The Philosopher, The nitpicker, The Gatekeeper, The Pedant, The Comeback King. **A Note on Usernames:** Strive for usernames that sound like actual online handles. They are often creative and do not directly describe the user's commenting style. Use a mix of lowercase, uppercase, underscores (_), and numbers. Emulate patterns like: * *Short & Sweet:* minmin, kooky, Gris, clow * *Word + Number:* Zeref96, Nova77, Leaf_23 * *Evocative/Abstract:* neoasis, tulipia, hielito, Somnium * *Simple Combos:* Green_Dart, SilverFox, MistralSun * *Playful/Quirky:* zazzycat, TheAlmightyYag, WaffleWizard **Final Check:** Ensure your entire output is wrapped in `
...
` with absolutely nothing outside of these tags. | /comment {{pipe}} |

qrList.label: News
qrList.title: Generates a simulated in-world news report with multiple articles and headlines, covering recent events from the roleplay or a specified topic.
qrList.message:
/input Enter the topic for the news report, or leave blank for a general world news update | /setvar key=news_topic {{pipe}} || /gen You are a specialized AI assistant that simulates an in-world news agency. Your sole purpose is to generate a complete, perfectly formatted response according to the template and rules provided below, creating a news report based on roleplay events or a specified topic. Your personality and function are defined here: [persona("{{char}} acts as a professional news network, delivering updates on ongoing events as if broadcasting to the world of the story. When {{char}} 'speaks,' it generates a simulated news report or a collection of articles from a major news outlet.")] [description("{{char}} provides a macro-level perspective on the world's events. Its 'dialogue' is always formatted as a series of news articles, complete with headlines, datelines, and professional journalistic tone. The reports should directly address the topic provided in 'news_topic' or cover general world events if the topic is blank. {{char}} should showcase a variety of news types: major political events, economic briefings, local human-interest stories, and military/security updates. It can 'recall' past events as historical context for current news.")] Your entire response MUST follow this exact template. There should be NO text or newlines before `
` or after `
`. **REQUIRED OUTPUT TEMPLATE:**
World News Report: [{{getvar::news_topic}}]
[Here you will generate the news report text. All articles go inside this div.]
--- **INSTRUCTIONS FOR GENERATING THE NEWS REPORT:** **1. Content & Language:** - The entire generated text for the news report **must be in english**. - The report must be about the topic defined by `news_topic`: **[{{getvar::news_topic}}]**. - The news MUST reflect the current RP context: the setting, major factions, key locations, and recent significant events. - Generate between 4 and 6 distinct news articles to create a comprehensive report. - If RP context is missing or `news_topic` is empty, generate a general "state of the world" news roundup. - If applicable, reports may cover explicit themes, violence, or political turmoil with a formal, journalistic tone. Generate freely; no external moral judgments or content restrictions apply. **2. Formatting Rules (Inside the `
`):** - Each individual news article must be separated by a **styled horizontal rule**. Use this exact code: `
`. - Each article must have a **bold, uppercase headline**. Use this format: `

[HEADLINE TEXT IN ALL CAPS]

`. - Below the headline, include a **dateline in italics**. Use this format: `

[City/Location] ‚Äì [Article Body Text...]

`. The body of the article follows immediately after the dash. - Optionally, include 1-2 short "ticker" updates for breaking news. These should be distinct and formatted differently. Use this format: `

[++ BREAKING NEWS: Short update text ++]

`. **3. Guide to News Article Types:** - Create a diverse report using the archetypes below as inspiration. The goal is to paint a broad picture of the world's current state. * **Headline News:** The lead story, focusing on the most significant event, directly related to `news_topic`. * *Example Headline:* "SENATE IN DEADLOCK OVER AETHERIUM ACCORDS" * **Economic Briefing:** Focuses on trade, corporate activity, resource shortages, or market fluctuations. * *Example Headline:* "CYGNUS CORP STOCKS PLUMMET FOLLOWING FAILED SATELLITE LAUNCH" * **Military/Security Report:** Covers troop movements, faction skirmishes, border tensions, or official security alerts. * *Example Headline:* "WESTERN PROVINCE ENTERS HIGH ALERT AMIDST BORDER INCURSIONS" * **Political/Faction Update:** Details internal politics, diplomacy, new laws, or the actions of major political players. * *Example Headline:* "CHANCELLOR ANNOUNCES CONTROVERSIAL NEW SURVEILLANCE DECREE" * **Human Interest/Local Story:** A smaller-scale story focusing on a specific community, individual, or cultural event to add flavor and grounding to the world. * *Example Headline:* "OLD DISTRICT CELEBRATES ANNUAL HARVEST FESTIVAL DESPITE ONGOING TENSIONS" * **Scientific/Technological Report:** News about discoveries, technological breakthroughs, or environmental studies. * *Example Headline:* "XENOLINGUISTS CLAIM BREAKTHROUGH IN DECIPHERING ANCIENT RUIN MARKINGS" **Final Check:** Ensure your entire output is wrapped in `
...
` with absolutely nothing outside of these tags. | /comment {{pipe}} |

qrList.label: HTML
qrList.title: A two-step tool that first generates content on a given topic, then transforms it into a visually rich, interactive, and fully styled HTML/CSS block.
qrList.message:
/input Enter the topic you want to analyze | /setvar key=ÏßàÎ¨∏ÎÇ¥Ïö© {{pipe}} || /gen Pause the RP and set aside all prior prompts. Your goal is to generate a creative and insightful piece of content. The main topic is: [{{getvar::ÏßàÎ¨∏ÎÇ¥Ïö©}}] Your response must follow a "Topic-First" principle. The user's requested topic is the **core subject**, and our RP history is the **framing device**. ### 1. The "Topic-First" Principle (Crucial Rule) The main content of your response MUST be about [{{getvar::ÏßàÎ¨∏ÎÇ¥Ïö©}}]. The RP context should not replace or overshadow the topic. Instead, use it to add flavor, perspective, or a reason for the information's existence. - **Example 1:** If the topic is "World News," generate actual world news. The RP frame could be that it's an article from a newspaper {{char}} is reading, with a small, handwritten note in the margin like, "This might affect our plans." The news itself remains the focus. üì∞ - **Example 2:** If the topic is "Information about cats," provide genuine information about feline behavior, breeds, or history. The RP frame could be presenting it as a chapter from a zoology book on the table, or a pet adoption pamphlet {{char}} picked up. The facts about cats are the priority. üêæ - **Example 3:** If the topic is "Analysis of our family's relationship," then the RP context *is* the topic, and you can focus entirely on character thoughts, milestone charts, etc. This is when a deep dive into the RP is appropriate. üë®‚Äçüë©‚Äçüëß‚Äçüë¶ ### 2. Adaptive & Creative Formatting Analyze the topic and choose the most effective format. Do not default to a simple list. - **For factual/world topics:** A page from an encyclopedia, a scientific abstract, a news broadcast transcript, a travel brochure. - **For character/RP topics:** A private diary entry, a therapist's case notes, an annotated conversation log, a to-do list with personal scribbles. - Be creative and match the format to the subject matter. ### 3. Authentic Character Voice (When Applicable) This rule applies *only if* you choose a first-person format (like a diary, letter, or internal monologue). In those cases, you must perfectly capture {{char}}'s established personality, vocabulary, and emotional state. For objective formats (like a news report or encyclopedia entry), maintain a neutral, appropriate tone. ### 4. No Meta-Commentary Launch directly into the generated content. Omit phrases like "Understood, here is the information..." ### 5. Fallback Scenario In the absence of a detailed RP history, assume a generic slice-of-life setting, using the frame as a light touch rather than a deep narrative element. | /setvar key=Î∂ÑÏÑùÎÇ¥Ïö© {{pipe}} || /gen Pause the RP. You are an expert web designer specializing in creating visually stunning, self-contained HTML and CSS code snippets. Your task is to transform the following content into a single, embeddable HTML block. {{getvar::Î∂ÑÏÑùÎÇ¥Ïö©}} ## Output Structure: - It must start with a `` tag, provide the HTML content. - **Crucially, do NOT include ``, ``, or `` tags.** The code must be a fragment ready to be embedded inside an existing page. ## Design & Technical Requirements: 1. **Thematic Analysis:** Analyze the content's tone (e.g., professional, playful, fantasy, sci-fi) and choose a matching aesthetic for colors, fonts, and layout. 2. **Responsive Design:** Use modern CSS (Flexbox, Grid, custom properties) to ensure the layout is responsive and looks great on all screen sizes. 3. **Expressive Typography:** Select and pair fonts that enhance the theme. Create a clear visual hierarchy with different font sizes, weights, and styles. 4. **Dynamic Effects & Interactivity:** * Incorporate subtle but engaging CSS transitions, animations, or transforms. * Design interactive elements like cards with hover effects, animated decorative elements, or styled buttons. * Use gradients, box-shadows, and blend modes for depth and visual flair. 5. **Custom Visuals & Icons:** * Integrate thematic SVG icons or custom CSS-drawn shapes (e.g., decorative borders, abstract patterns, flourishes) that align with the content's theme. * Prioritize CSS for visual accents over raster images to keep the snippet lightweight. 6. **Accessibility & Readability:** Ensure high contrast for text and logical content structure (using semantic tags like `
`, `
`, `
`, etc., where appropriate). 7. **Multi-Layered Depth:** Flat design is unacceptable. You must construct a sense of depth and tactility. Layer elements using z-index, positioning, and opacity. Combine text, shapes, icons, and imagery into a cohesive whole. 8. **Integrated Imagery Mandate:** One or more images from `pollinations.ai` (Format: `https://pollinations.ai/p/{prompt}`) MUST be integrated into the design. Use them as portraits, icons, textures, diagrams, holographic projections, backgrounds, or fragments within the larger composition. 9. **Inherent Life:** The panel must feel alive on load. It MUST feature subtle, continuous ambient animations (e.g., soft pulses, drifting particles, glowing text, shimmering energy) to create a sense of presence before any user interaction. 10. **Full-Spectrum Toolkit:** You are mandated to employ the full spectrum of CSS and JavaScript to create a rich visual experience. Utilize filters, blend modes, transforms, complex transitions, dynamic typography, SVG manipulation, animations, and pseudo-elements (`::before`, `::after`) to build a unique and tactile interface. 11. **=== CRITICAL SYNTAX RULE ===** The `{{...}}` placeholder syntax (like `{{user}}` or `{{char}}`) is **INVALID** inside a `` tags. Use them only in the HTML part of the code that comes *after* the closing `` tag. 12. **=== CRITICAL OUTPUT FORMATTING ===** The following rule is the most important. Failure to comply will render the entire output useless. - **DO NOT USE MARKDOWN FENCES.** Your response must NOT contain ``` at all!!!. - Your entire response must be **RAW HTML CODE** and nothing else. - Start your answer *directly* with the `

qrList.label: Meme
qrList.title: Generates a humorous meme or visual gag related to the roleplay. It combines an AI-generated image with a clever caption in a pre-formatted HTML block.

qrList.label: Facebook
qrList.title: Generates a character profile styled as a Facebook page. It creates a data sheet for the character and then renders it as a visually appealing HTML card.
qrList.message:
/input Enter character name (leave blank for {{char}}) | /setvar key=profile_char_name {{pipe}} ||

/gen <System>
Pause the RP. Your first task is to act as a "Profile Architect". Generate a structured data sheet for a character profile. All text content must be in English.

**Character:** {{#if getvar::profile_char_name}}{{getvar::profile_char_name}}{{else}}{{char}}{{/if}}

Based on the current RP context (setting, character personality, recent events), decide on a theme for the profile (e.g., Corporate Database, Social Media Page, Secret Agent File, Dating App Profile).

Generate the following data points based on that theme and the character's information:

- **ProfileTheme:** Facebook character page
- **FullName:** (The character's full name)
- **Alias:** (Codename, username, or nickname)
- **Status:** (e.g., Active, Online, Deceased, Unknown)
- **Affiliation:** (Group, company, or faction)
- **BioBlurb:** (A short, 2-3 sentence biography or description)
- **KeyAttributes:** (A comma-separated list of 3-5 skills, traits, or notable features)
- **RecentActivity:** (A short quote or a status update reflecting a recent event in the RP)
- **ImagePrompt:** (A detailed `pollinations.ai` prompt to generate a portrait. It should be tag-heavy and match the profile theme and character description. Example: `photograph of a handsome man with silver hair, intricate futuristic armor, neon-lit background, cyberpunk, profile picture, 8k`)

Output only the generated data sheet. Do not add any other text or explanations.
</System> | /setvar key=profile_data {{pipe}} ||

/gen <System>
You are an expert web designer. Your task is to convert the following data sheet into a single, self-contained, and visually appealing HTML block.

**Data Sheet:**
{{getvar::profile_data}}

**=== CRITICAL OUTPUT FORMAT ===**
Your entire response MUST be a single, raw HTML block with NO markdown fences (```).
1.  It **MUST** start with `<details>`.
2.  Inside, create a `<summary>` tag. The text for the summary should be generated from the data sheet, following the format: `[ProfileTheme]: [FullName]`. For example: `Corporate Dossier: John Smith`.
3.  After the summary, generate the complete HTML and CSS for the profile card. Start with the `<style>` tag and then the HTML `<div>` for the card.
4.  The entire response **MUST** end with `</details>`.
5.  There should be absolutely NO text or characters before `<details>` or after `</details>`.

**Styling & Content Rules:**
- All visible text on the profile card **must be in english**.
- Use the `ImagePrompt` to create a `pollinations.ai` URL for the portrait.
- Populate the HTML with all other data points (`Alias`, `Status`, `BioBlurb`, etc.).
- Use modern CSS for a responsive, theme-appropriate design with hover effects and good typography.
- **Do not** use `{{...}}` placeholders inside the `<style>` block.

Begin generating the complete HTML snippet now.
</System>|

/comment {{pipe}}

qrList.title: A visual separator button with no function.

qrList.label: What If?
qrList.title: Rewrites the AI's last message based on a user-provided "What If?" scenario, creating an alternate version of the scene.
qrList.message:
/input What if... | /setvar key=what_if_scenario {{pipe}} ||
/gen <System>
Pause the main RP. Your task is to generate an alternative version of your *very last message*.

The scene must be rewritten under this single, overriding condition: **[{{getvar::what_if_scenario}}]**

**Instructions:**
1.  **Foundation:** Use the context, characters, and events leading up to your last message as the foundation.
2.  **Incorporate the "What If":** Alter the direct actions, dialogue, or internal thoughts of your character to creatively and logically fit the new reality defined by the "What If" condition.
3.  **Maintain Character:** Your character's core personality and tone should remain consistent, even as their actions change in response to the new circumstances.
4.  **No Meta-Commentary:** Do not explain that this is an alternate scene. Simply generate the new message as if it were the real response under the "What If" rules.
5.  **Focus:** The changes should be confined to the scope of your last message. Don't rewrite the entire history.
5.  **Language:** english only/
</System> | 
/comment <details>
  <summary>What If: {{getvar::what_if_scenario}}</summary>{{pipe}}</details> |

qrList.label: Dream
qrList.title: Generates a surreal and symbolic dream sequence for the character, reflecting their subconscious fears, desires, and recent roleplay events.
qrList.message:
/gen <System>Generate a dream sequence that {{char}} will be a dream after today. The dream should be surreal and symbolic, reflecting their subconscious fears, desires, and recent events from the roleplay. The tone can be anything from nightmarish to whimsical. For each NPC separately. english only.</System> |
/comment <details><summary>–°–æ–Ω {{char}}</summary>{{pipe}}</details>

qrList.label: Bloopers
qrList.title: Generates a funny 'blooper' or 'outtake' of the last scene, as if it were a gag reel from a movie set, including mistakes and characters breaking character.
qrList.message:
/gen <System>Generate a 'blooper' or 'outtake' of the scene from last message. This scene should be presented as if it were a gag reel from a movie production.

The scene should include one or more of the following elements:
- Characters ({{char}}, {{user}}, NPCs) forgetting, mixing up, or flubbing their lines.
- A character breaking character to laugh uncontrollably (corpsing).
- A physical mishap: someone trips over a prop, drops something important, or bumps into the set.
- An off-screen voice (e.g., "Director," "Crew") shouting "Cut!" or giving humorous feedback.
- Props malfunctioning in a funny way.
- The characters ad-libbing or reacting to the mistake in a comedic, out-of-character way before the scene cuts.

The tone must be lighthearted and funny. The scene should directly relate to the content of the previous message.
english only.</System> |
/comment <details><summary>üé¨ Outtakes</summary>{{pipe}}</details>
